intro: Alzatea mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican alzatea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Alzatea mexicana is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
